paragraph.heading:
Bulbophyllum secundum Hook.
f.,
Fl. Brit. India
5: 764, 1890

subSubSection.paragraph:
Homotypic synonym:
Phyllorkis secunda
(Hook.f.) Kuntze,
Revis. Gen . Pl.
2: 678, 1891.

Specimens examined:—
CHIN . Mindat District : Swinhoe 122 ( K ); same loc.,
1700−2030 m
,
21 May 2004
, Tanaka et al. 031004 ( MBK ); same loc.,
2030−2295 m
,
27 Jun 2009
,
Tanaka & Yukawa 081264
( MBK ); same loc.,
2200 m
,
24 May 2012
, Fujikawa et al. 089204 ( MBK ); same loc.,
1760 m
,
11 Jul 2013
,
Mu Mu Aung et al. 092414
( MBK ). MANDALAY. Pyinoolwin District :
1220 m
,
Samuel 13549
( K ); Mandalay District :
White 380
( US *); same loc.,
White 406
( US *)
.
SHAN . Taunggyi District : fide Nyan Tun (2014: 77 ; as
Bulbophyllum sp.
)
. WITHOUT LOCALITY. Without collector s.n. ( K ), det.
J . J . Vermeulen. Reported from Kachin State and Sagaing and Magway regions by
Kress et al. (2003: 67)
, but we have not seen any material from these areas
.

Distribution:— The Himalayas, northeastern India , Myanmar , Thailand , Indochina and southwestern China . Notes:— The two collections from Mandalay Region marked with (*) are possibly the same collection; one number was cited by Seidenfaden (1979: 103) , the second by Vermeulen (2002: 131 & 135).

Bulbophyllum shanicum
King & Pantl., J. Asiat. Soc. Bengal , Pt.
2, Nat . Hist. 66: 587, 1897. Type :— MYANMAR . Shan Hills :
5 Oct 1890
,
Abdul Huk s.n.
( holotype : CAL; isotype: K)

Specimens examined:—
SHAN . Unspecified : type ; Taunggyi District :
1370 m
,
25 Oct 1939
, Dickason 9036 ( AMES )
.
Distribution:— Eastern Myanmar and southwestern China .

Bulbophyllum siamense Rchb.
f., Gard. Chron . 1867: 572, 1867. Type :— MYANMAR (not Siam). Mon State : Mawlamyine District ,
Parish s.n.
, sent to Low , cult.
Day s.n.
( holotype : W-R 52449 ; icon. Day s.n. K)

Homotypic synonyms:
Bulbophyllum lobbii Lindl. var. siamense
(Rchb.f.) Rchb.f., Refug. Bot. [Saunders] 2: t. 116, 1872.
Bulbophyllum lobbii subsp. siamense
(Rchb.f.) Mangal, F.Velazquez & J.J.Verm.,
Bulbophyllum Borneo
: 40, 2015.

Specimens examined:—
MON . Mawlamyine District : type ; same loc., icon.
Parish 30
( W-R 11573 ); same loc., icon. Parish 187 ( K , W-R 11572 )
.
Distribution:— The eastern Himalayas, northeastern India , southern Myanmar , Thailand , Indochina and western Malesia .

Bulbophyllum sichyobulbon C.S.P.Parish & Rchb.
f., Trans. Linn. Soc. London 30: 152, 1874. Types :— MYANMAR . Tenasserim :
Parish 193B
( lectotype K, designated by Seidenfaden 1979: 143 ; isolectotype: W-R 2288 ).
Syntype : MYANMAR . Tenasserim :
Lobb s.n.
( syntype : K-LINDL )

Homotypic synonym:
Phyllorkis sichyobulbon
(C.S.P.Parish & Rchb.f.) Kuntze,
Revis. Gen . Pl.
2: 678, 1891.

Specimens examined:—
MANDALAY . Myingyan District : fide
Aung et al. (2020: 67)
.
SHAN . Hopang District :
23 Dec 1936
,
Po Khant 15230
( K ), ident. uncertain. TENASSERIM. Types cited
.
TANINTHARYI . Dawei District :
260 m
,
23 Mar 2012
,
Saw Lwin et al. TNRO 4
( SING , SING [s]), ident. uncertain. Reported from
Mon State by
Kress et al . (2003: 67)
, but we have not seen any material from this area.

Bulbophyllum sillemianum Rchb.
f., Gard. Chron. , n.s., 22: 166, 1884. Type :— MYANMAR . Without locality: cult.
Schlim s.n.
( holotype : W)

Homotypic synonym:
Phyllorkis sillemiana
(Rchb.f.) Kuntze,
Revis. Gen . Pl.
2: 678, 1891.
Specimens examined:— WITHOUT LOCALITY. Type ; cult. material (K); cult. Day s.n. (icon. K). Distribution:— Endemic.
